unnormalised: **Manufacturing & Supply Chain: Accurate Inventory Forecasting Crucial for Festive Season**
normalised: Manufacturing and Supply Chain: Accurate Inventory Forecasting Crucial for Festive Season

unnormalised: Mumbai, India – As Diwali approaches on November 12th, 2024, accurate inventory forecasting is proving critical for manufacturers and suppliers across India. A recent report from IIM Ahmedabad highlights a 20% increase in demand volatility compared to last year.
normalised: Mumbai, India – As Diwali approaches on twelfth November, two thousand and twenty four, accurate inventory forecasting is proving critical for manufacturers and suppliers across India. A recent report from I I M Ahmedabad highlights a twenty percent increase in demand volatility compared to last year.

unnormalised: Companies like Tata Steel and Reliance Retail are leveraging advanced AI-powered forecasting tools to optimize stock levels and minimize waste. "Getting it right means meeting the surge in demand for everything from diyas to mithai without overstocking," explains Ms. Priya Sharma, a supply chain consultant. The challenge lies in predicting regional variations; demand for firecrackers in Sivakasi, Tamil Nadu, peaks significantly earlier than in other states.

unnormalised: Small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), often reliant on traditional methods, face a greater hurdle. Workshops conducted by the MSME Development Institute on October 27th, 2023, at 14:00 hrs focused on affordable forecasting solutions. Miscalculations can lead to substantial losses, especially with perishable goods like sweets and flowers. With the auspicious time for Lakshmi Puja starting at 19:00 hrs on Diwali night, retailers hope their inventory predictions prove accurate. Experts predict a clearer picture will emerge by December 15th, 2024, after the post-Diwali sales data is analyzed.
